review.rating: The best place to stay in Da Nang!

review.rating: Amazing stay and an amazing staff. Feel like weâ€™re taken care of.
review.comment_positive:
- This cute little hotel was amazing. Great locations as itâ€™s close 5mins walk to the beach. Close to a few restaurants and shops. 

- we love the staff at Minhâ€™s Boutique, they all greeted us whole heartily and ensure us that they will make our stay as comfortable as they can. 
I must give special thanks to Duyen, as she went out of her way to ensure me and my sister had a good night sleep as she was worried that the water pump in our room was having some repairs and thought it might affect our sleep.
She check up on us about our stay and reminded us if there anything we needed she and the staff will do the best they can. 

- The breakfast was minimal but always have a Vietnamese breakfast special which they always change daily. So you wonâ€™t be bored.

review.rating: Beautiful space, great service, amazing location
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng TiÃªu Chuáº©n 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i GhÃªÌ Sofa
review.comment_positive: We liked that the hotel was within a 5-minutes walk to the beach, so it remains accessible without all the noise of the main street. Several halal restaurants nearby so that's great for Muslim travellers. The room was big and spacious, the beds comfortable. The staff at the hotel were so helpful. They reached out to us via WhatsApp the day before and maintained an open chat with us each day to check if we needed any help such as finding transport to Hoi An or Ba Na Hills.

review.comment_positive:
We loved everything about our stay here.
It was the perfect tranquil, relaxing stay we were looking for after doing the Hi Van Pass from Hue.
The bed was comfy, the food delicious, the property was exactly like the pictures. 
The staff were kind and accommodating, and easy to communicate with. 
We were given great advice for our stay and our journey onwards.

review.comment_positive: The breakfast offered a satisfying experience. Although there weren't many options, what was available was sufficient and enjoyable.
review.comment_negative:
The room did not justify its price. On my first day, I encountered disappointment as the room was left uncleansed, with bed linens unchanged, visible grime on pillowcases, and evidence of prior occupants. Moreover, the alternative room I had booked emitted a moldy scent upon entry, with a discarded toilet roll found beneath the bed and unchanged bed linens. I had to reach out to reception around 8:30 PM to request bed replacement. Despite having ample time to thoroughly clean and inspect the rooms before guest check-in, the issue remained unaddressed.

The following day, the manager approached me to apologize and offered to upgrade my room. Additionally, she kindly provided complimentary drinks as a gesture of goodwill. Drawing from my experience of over 5 years in the hospitality industry and having stayed in various hotels, I also shared some constructive feedback with her. Despite the initial setback, I appreciated the manager's efforts to address the situation and ensure a more pleasant stay.

review.rating: A lovely experience in Da Nang !

review.comment_positive: This is one of the lovely properties we stayed during our recent trip and loved our stay here a lot. The Koi pond in the lobby / breakfast area is so beautiful. Room is super neat and clean. The staff goes beyond their duty to make your stay comfortable. The beach is just a 2 min walk away is another benefit.

review.rating: Amazing Best hotel in DaNang â­â­â­â­â­
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng TiÃªu Chuáº©n 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i GhÃªÌ Sofa
review.comment_positive:
Best hotel in DaNang â­â­â­â­â­

Facilities -
Welcomed with open arms, a lovely tea and snacks on arrival.
Beautiful hotel facilities with gorgeous koi pond, lovely restaurant area overlooking the gorgeous koi pond. Perfect for relaxation. The pool area is on the top floor with views! 
The breakfast had many options which changed throughout our stay it was my first time to try local speciality Cao Lau which was so tasty. Also very accommodating to my vegan/vegetarian friend.
-Rooms were clean, spacious and well appointed with room for suitcase, comfortable beds.
Location -
A quiet spot close to everything!
- Only a short cab ride from the airport.
- In a great spot with lovely restaurants near by such as Non La for some great local Vietnamese cuisine.
- A short walk to the beach and a safe swimming area. Plus many bars and beach Front restaurants to choose from.
- Close to the son Tra Night Market and famous Dragon Bridge.

Staff -
â­â­â­â­â­
Most helpful and attentive staff at a hotel ever. Ms Evie certainly made our stay was ever so warm, friendly and helpful. Helped us to suggest dinner options, to help with local travel also. Very much appreciated her amazing level of service and she is an asset to the hotel! Thanks again Ms Evie!

If you plan to stay in DaNang please choose Minh Boutique hotel!

review.rating: Had high hopes from initial review before booking but turned out so so
review.comment_positive: Great ambiance, friendly staff.
review.comment_negative:
Soundproofing can be better. Thereâ€™s a karaoke behind my room and I could hear people singing every night. In addition, I could hear the water pipe draining water from the room directly above me. 

The design of the room is not ideal. Thereâ€™s no power socket anywhere near the bed, so to charge your phone, you need to put it 2 meters away. Thereâ€™s also no light switch within reach near the bed, so if you want to switch off lights when going to bed, youâ€™ll have to get up, switch all the lights off, then feel your way back to bed in darkness. Not sure if the person who designed the room actually spent a night inside.

It was a wonderful stay.
The hotel itself is in a good location, just 5-7 minutes to the beach, 5 minutes to the night market by taxi.
The hotel itself is very beautiful, plants everywhere, a pool for fish on the first floor. The room is spacious, cozy, the bed is comfortable. The service was second to none from the start. They welcomed us, told us everything, took us to the rooms. All the staff were very very nice. Breakfast - delicious, varied, you can get freshly fried eggs and pho soup every morning. The coffee was the tastiest I had tasted in Vietnam. The hotel staff even gave it to us as a gift, so we can taste it in Lithuania as well. So we highly recommend this hotel.

This place is lovely for sure but I donâ€™t feel itâ€™s amazing and deserves the very high ratings it gets.

 Breakfast was fine. Had a good variety but not amazing.

review.comment_negative: Iâ€™m not sure where to startâ€¦two night stay in top apartmentâ€¦no safe in room or safe at reception, in my many years of travelling Iâ€™ve never come across this, we had to take all our valuables passports etc out with us daily as the doors did not lock properly, very tired and  filthy room, the bed curtains were disgusting, mattress very old, there is a large broken glass panel on the rooftop of which someone is going to have a terrible accident with at some point, breakfast not acceptable, the bathroom smelt dreadful and lots of items broken including shower head hanging off the wall and door handle broken, the tv did not work, there was mention of a refund of which we said to be fair 50% would be acceptable but the manager/owner only came back with a 30% of one night stay of which we gave to the lady on reception for being so apologetic, Iâ€™m not quite sure why this hotel had such good reviews but I feel I need to let other potential guest know the true situation with this hotel, thatâ€™s what a review is for, a true and honest reflection of your experience!

review.comment_negative: After reading all the nice reviews and seeing the good rating, we were really excited to come to this hotel. Unfortunately it was one big disappointment. Extremely noisy, you can hear people moving furniture above you, kids screaming in corridors and lobby, karaoke music at night. The room design is beautiful but impractical, windows are facing opposite rooms so basically everyone can see inside, we had our curtains closed almost all the time to get some privacy and felt like in a cave. There are no plugs or nightstands next to the bed, no place to hang towels or swimsuits. Also one of the worst breakfasts we had, poor choice, lack of fresh fruit. We basically ate PBJ toast and bland fried eggs for 4 days. Definitely not worth the money we spent.

review.rating: Wonderful Boutique Hotel near the Beach in a Great Location
review.comment_positive:
This was perhaps our favorite hotel during our 30 day Vietnam visit to multiple cities and National Parks.   The public spaces were beautifully decorated.    We loved the open courtyard with the small pond and planters, complete with colorful fish and even a visiting toad, during the evening.  The seating areas and restaurant adjacent to the pond were terrific places to relax. It rained during our visit, and we loved that it fell into the pond and open courtyard, but we could sit close-by under ceiling and stay dry.  The greenery throughout the hotel, both inside and out, was a lovely touch, and nicely juxtaposed to the cement-jungle of Danang.

The staff were super accommodating and spoke enough English to communicate well.   They had a very good and reasonably priced laundry service.  I asked for a couple of sewing repairs,  and they had someone outside the hotel do it.   When they discovered that I preferred less meat and enjoyed tofu, they made a special trip to the local  â€œmarketâ€ to some for my breakfasts.    We felt very cared for as guests.

Our room was wonderful. There was lots of wood and the decor was pretty and comfortable, including our bed.   While we did not take advantage of the kitchenette, except for the small fridge, it was a nice option.  It was terrific how our large room windows looked over the courtyard from the sitting area and streets from our bath area.   Plus, there were adequate window coverings. We liked that the shower was separated from the toilet and that the sink area was separated from both.  This gave us more flexibility when needing those facilities.  (The only downside was the little step-ups between the bathroom and room, where we kept stubbing our toes when leaving the bathroom.  It would be helpful if they put small wedges there to prevent this from happening.)

Unfortunately, during our last night, our ceiling in the bathroom area, sprung a leak.  The hotel staff were equally surprised and handled the incident graciously.
review.comment_negative: little â€œstep-upsâ€ between to bathroom and bedroom

review.rating: Not a practical hotel. $460 USD for 3 nights down the drain.
review.room_type: CÄƒn Há»™ NhÃ¬n Ra Há»“ BÆ¡i
review.comment_positive:
staff is outstanding - they shouldnâ€™t be mistreated by management if they are doing their best and itâ€™s not their fault that the hotel layout or architecture sucks. The staff are all super friendly and respectful. asked how was our sleep, provided one way airport transportation for us, killed the spider in the middle of the night when we called, and gave us free laundry for stating about no hot water. 

the lobby is pretty
review.comment_negative:
We chose this hotel specifically for the penthouse room, thinking itâ€™ll be a nice and relaxing last few days for our vacation and new years. But super disappointed as it was highly uncomfortable and stressful. For the price point of $460 USD we could have gotten a way better room / hotel. The issue we had are like basic needs / basic things hotels should not have any issues with such as - 


- No hot water - it only lasts for 5 minutes or so. Also the main reason we got this room is for the tub and the hot water runs out every few minutes and then we have to wait 10  minutes and the tub doesnâ€™t even fill half way. So we couldnâ€™t even use it. 
- Mold on shower head - shower head is also short so our head is eye level with the mold too.  
- Spiders/ bugs ( 4 - top of mirror, tub, on my clothes, outside ac vent) - one night we got the front desk to exterminate one of them in the vent because it was pretty big. 
- Bed pillow smells like mildew / damp smell !
- Super loud due to thin glass/ walls - you hear everythinggg outside. Woke up so many times through the night 

Others
- Shower head too short - we have to bend down to shower  
- No mirror light .. itâ€™s so dark at night and canâ€™t even see anything by the sink
- Way too cold in the open bathroom concept 
- Spider webs between wall cracks


Yes the hotel lobby is beautiful and the staff has outstanding service but the room itself does not live close to the standards we expect for that type of price point ($460 USD).

review.rating: Despite of the noise, I would still recommend Minh Boutique.

review.comment_negative: There was karaoke noise coming from outside the hotel that I could hear from my room and pool area.  There was practically open karaoke everywhere in Vietnam and is impossible to avoid the noise.  I've no objection to people enjoying karaoke but they could do it in a confined or enclosed area.  I personally think Vietnam could do their tourism with less noise!  Is just very tiring being bombarded by noise constantly.

- helpful & friendly staff (greeted with coconut biscuits & tea on arrival)
- room; clean & had a comfortable bed 
- great location; close to the beach

review.comment_negative:
We gave some of the below feedback to Reception when asked & they very kindly gave us bottled water & packets of coconut cookies as a thank you:
 
- room; aesthetically pleasing but not very practical. A few examples: only one plug socket in the studio kitchen / bedroom, but 4 in the bathroom! No light switches near the bed, bedside tables/shelves, or reading lamps. Not much counter space in the bathroom for doing makeup 
- breakfast; items arenâ€™t covered so sometimes there are small fruit flies around the food 
- sound insulation; we were on the top floor (5) with only the pool above us but could hear what sounded like heavy furniture being dragged at random times of night / early morning. could also hear plates & cutlery clanging in the morning, presumably being washed. thereâ€™s also a very(!) loud karaoke bar behind the hotel that didnâ€™t stop til about 1am on a Sunday night

review.comment_positive: The size of the room, the decor, the lobby area with the little pond with koi fish, the breakfast buffet food, the location to the beach.
review.comment_negative:
These are minor comments: The bathroom sink area did not have enough space to hang a small hand towel after you wash your hands or face.  The shower and toilet doors have a horizontal bar to hang clothes or towels, but maybe an additional hook on the wall would be good too.

Did not like how the curtains were installed in the queen room with garden view.  This room has a door with glass panel.  The curtains open from the left (where the door is located) to the right. Because it opens from the door side, people walking pass the room can see inside the room through the door.  Not much privacy with curtains opened. Suggestion:  It would be better if the front door has it's own separate door shade, (door blind or door shade).  The way it is,  people walking pass the room can see guests inside as well as their stuff. 
Despite these minor comments, I would definitely return to this hotel again because it's just a wonderful place to stay. ğŸ‘

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng TiÃªu Chuáº©n 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i GhÃªÌ Sofa
review.comment_positive:
A true gem in Vietnam! We spent only two nights at this fantastic hotel, which, however, exceeded our expectations by far. We've been traveling through Vietnam for some time now, but this hotel is undoubtedly the best in its price range. Upon our arrival, we were warmly greeted by the staff who immediately infected us with their good spirits and positive atmosphere. Their service deserves highest praise as they were always friendly and helpful. The concept of the interior design is well-thought-out and creates a welcoming atmosphere. Our room was spotlessly clean and was thoroughly cleaned daily. The pool area is also a highlight, and we enjoyed relaxing there. Additionally, we were able to easily rent a motorbike, which made our stay even more enjoyable. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel â€“ you definitely can't go wrong here!
Furthermore, I must mention that the breakfast was also excellent and fully satisfying. It truly complemented our stay. The location of the hotel is also excellent, as it is very central, making it convenient to explore the surrounding area. We would definitely love to visit this hotel again in the future.

The room and a
Overall ambience was charming and welcoming, very pleasant feel. Rooms were spacious and we had a great view overlooking the pond. value for money.

review.rating: Best hotel in Vietnam during our trip

review.comment_positive:
Minh Boutique was our first stay in Vietnam. Since then we stayed at 5 other different accommodation and then could not get even close to the stay at minh boutique.

The staff is amazing the food is fantastic and the surrounding are astonishing. 
My wife is an interior architect and she was amazed by how well planned and designed minh boutique is.

The one in the middle is great. If you als they will also let your kids feed the fish.

All in all a 10/10
review.comment_negative:
The only bad thing about minh boutique is that all other accommodations will not be able to compete.
As minh boutique was our first stay in Vietnam it sort of set a standard for us. You should not make the same mistake or you will meet a lot of disappointments afterwards ;)

Either book minh boutique at the end of your stay as a highlight or book it knowing that it is outstanding.

review.rating: Charming hotel, close to the beach
review.comment_positive: Minh Boutique is a charming property in Da Nang. We stayed here for 7 nights in two different rooms. The rooms are spacious, clean and have comfortable beds. The hotel staff is friendly and attentive. They offer a laundry service, which is slightly expensive but very convenient.
review.comment_negative:
The hotel is very Instagram-friendly, and the pictures posted on the booking are kind of misleading. Most of the pictures are taken from the penthouse - which is one room in the entire hotel. The terrace is not that great, especially at this time of the year - the pool is not heated, there are two chairs, and the pillows look quite dirty. 
Breakfast - we took it only once, during our 7-night stay - we missed fresh/warm food - a lack of fresh fruit, juices, and warm food options. It looked way better on the pictures, and we expected more. 
The lack of electricity plug in the studio looking to the garden - it is kind of annoying to have only 2 plugs in the whole room.
The noise - there is no soundproofing, we could hear the person next to our room sneeze. Also, the aircon is loud. 
Overall, the price-to-quality ratio is quite bad. It is pricy for what you get unless your goal is to take some pics for the social media.

I really admired the proactiveness of the staff. Overall, this is an awesome place to stay....I'll surely come again.

I really love the hotel's stylish decoration! Every corner is beautiful! The surroundings are filled with plants, and the rooms have music and scented candles, which create a relaxing atmosphere. The bed in the room is also very comfortable!
The hotel staffs are very friendly and attentive to the guests' experience. As my birthday was approaching, they specially prepared a delicious chocolate cake for me. The front desk staff told me that the little cake is from the best bakery in Danang, and I was truly touched by their recommendation!
I could feel their dedication to the guests everywhere. The breakfast was average, but the beverage shop outside the hotel was amazing! We tried the coconut coffee and strawberry yogurt drink recommended by the staff, and they were both delicious, especially the coconut coffee, which was the best coconut coffee I've ever had in Danang!
Overall, the hotel is comfortable and beautiful, and the coconut coffee is amazing. The service provided by the staff is excellent! I will definitely stay here again if I come to Danang next time!

Fantastic hotel on a quiet street within 5 minute walk of My Khe beach and plenty of restaurants!
Walked in and straight away we got a welcome drink and biscuits! We managed to check in earlier and hire a scooter straight away to head to Ba Na Hills which was fantastic as we only had two days to explore Da Nang. Beautiful exterior and interior design with lovely rooms. Breakfast was very nice and the staff are absolute stars! Very attentive, they could not do enough for you and do a fantastic job of making sure every guest is happy. We will we could have stayed longer! Would recommend to anyone staying in Da Nang!

review.comment_positive: Very great hotel!! The interior design is very elegant & beautiful. Everything is very clean. The staff was very very friendly and help you with everything you need. The hotel's interior was good-looking, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was welcoming.

After two nights of taking cold showers, my solution was to cancel the rest of my stay and look for another hotel.

review.rating: absolutely beautiful! weâ€™ll definitely come back!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng TiÃªu Chuáº©n 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i GhÃªÌ Sofa
review.comment_positive:
this is why I like booking at Boutique hotels. i love everything about Minh Boutique! itâ€™s pretty, cozy, and it has a beautiful koi pond which my son Pierce really enjoyed. Our room had enough space and we liked the cute bathroom window. i love Minh boutiqueâ€™s small details, so authentic (beautiful tea sets, the wooden accent wall, the hanging boats at the breakfast lounge). what I love most are the staff! it was my sonâ€™s 7th birthday so I had MUN (the manager) prepare a cake. in the hotel they play centralized music which can be heard in all rooms (there is a switch to adjust the volume in the room) and they played happy birthday before they knocked on our door.  Mun and the hotel staff came in with my sonâ€™s birthday cake and sang him a happy birthday song!  thank you for making our trip even more special. 

the hotel looks new but with some beautiful traditional Vietnamese touches on the design. itâ€™s clean, it smells wonderful, and it has a beautiful garden view. Mun was very helpful, she handed me a pocket brochure that serves as a guide, it has a list of things to do, places to visit, and cafes and restaurants to check out around Da Nang. i had no idea thereâ€™s a light show at the bridge on weekends and she suggested we see it. my son really enjoyed the show at the bridge:) 

thanks Minh boutique, Mun, and the rest of the staff.

review.rating: Beautiful hotel, service (not due to a lack of trying) a bit lacking
review.comment_positive: The staff was really friendly. The hotel itself is very beautiful, the pond in the middle, the chirping birds, the rooftop swimming pool and the room itself.
review.comment_negative: There were no conveniently placed power sockets, but that is minor (we charged our phone in the bathroom). The breakfast was nothing special, it is worth mentioning they had a very strange-looking spaghetti Bolognese. We didn't dare to come to close. Otherwise, breakfast was fine. The day before we left, we asked them to do our laundry, which they accepted and said they would be ready the same day. However, when we asked the following morning before we wanted to leave, it was not ready. In the end they rushed it to us (still a bit wet, not that bad), but we needed to wait on it before we could leave. Couldn't book us a cheap bus somewhere, only expensive private transfers. They are really friendly and try to help you, just not always able do it the right way.

I can only say: if you're coming to Da Nang, stay at Minh Boutique. After over a week of travelling in Vietnam, arriving at this hotel was the best feeling. Best hotel we have found on this holiday so far. All the staff are so friendly and helpful.
The room is not huge but it is very comfortable, well designed and decorated, you have everything you need. Loved little extra touches like the slippers, bathrobes, essential oil and soft music.

Thank you Minh Boutique

review.rating: Really happy with my stay, would recommend.
review.comment_positive: Staff were super helpful. Location and facilities great for the price

Beautiful wooden architectural details from the outside entrance to the reception area are the first thing we noticed. We were warmly welcomed with cold tea and coconut biscuits by the serene koi pond. Our garden view rooms were very comfortable and thoughtfully laid out. We liked the clean modern aesthetic in the wooden chairs and handles in the bathroom area. The sink was a beautiful granite bowl. Enjoyed the piped in music and bird sounds. You control the volume or can turn it off if you donâ€™t want to listen to it.
Looking down into the interior garden from our 5th floor rooms was special. 
We enjoyed swimming in the lovely rooftop infinity pool each day. 
Breakfast was delicious with many choices of Vietnamese food. Western egg choices and toast were also available. 
Also just a short walk to My Khe beach! 
Friendly helpful staff. 

We would stay here again.
review.comment_negative:
Outside our rooms was a wooden box with room number and you could toggle down the â€œmakeup roomâ€ or â€œdo not disturbâ€ wooden sign. It was a unique and cool feature. 
Would have been helpful to have been shown this when we checked in. 
Some Bath Towels and bed linens were frayed. 
Replacing those would be nice.

The rooms were nice, however, they lacked some basic functions like sockets near beds, hooks to hang the towels or space around the sink for the toiletries. We had to find creative ways to go about this. 
The idea of rooms facing inner courtyard is nice, however, once you are in the room, it feels a bit strange to be seen by others as well as being able to see other people in their rooms so we kept our curtain closed for the majority of time which means we didn't have much sunlight in the room.

review.rating: fantastic authentic and clean stay right in the centre of da nang.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive: very authentic and clean. service was fantastic, highly recommend for a couple to stay.
review.comment_negative: bathroom area was smaller, but still manageable.

review.comment_positive:
Beautiful courtyard with koi pond in the middle, which was lovely if you intend to spend time at the hotel chilling. The beach (My Khe beach) was also relatively close, just 7 mins walk away but you will need to e-hail a car if you intend to visit the night markets. Breakfast was alright, but being a boutique hotel of just 24 rooms - decent enough but don't expect a huge spread.

They were very prompt with replies via e-mail and pro-active in offering help/confirming special requests, so kudos to the team there.
review.comment_negative:
There's only one tiny lift to service the building but since it's only 5 floors, guess you can walk up if the lift is full/busy. The room we stayed in (501) had its back facing the main road so you can definitely hear the noise levels, including loud music from the main street. The other room we had (506) wasn't cleaned so well (dust on the cupboards, some ants) but perhaps it was because we came at 1.45pm and the room wasn't quite ready yet and they had to rush it. 
The sink is small (literally no place to put anything on the table), likewise - there was no bedside table. Aesthetically very pleasing but not so practical.

review.comment_positive: Staff, they were extremely helpful in every sense. Location was great, rooms were functional even if sightly small, walking distance from beach.

Such a beautiful and peaceful hotel, surrounded by a koi fish pond and green walls. only a few short minutes from the beach, and the rooftop pool is stunning for a dip. 

The Suite (room) was a perfect size, with a small kitchenette and beautiful decor. All the managing staff were super friendly, and always there to help with every question, to organise a motorbike, coffee orders and serve delicious breakfast every day! A wonderful stay in a quiet part of Da Nang.
review.comment_negative: I was there for remote working, so would suggest some additional wall sockets for charging and one near the bed. Only one (on the desk) provided is not enough.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng TiÃªu Chuáº©n 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n Vá»›i GhÃªÌ Sofa
review.comment_positive: The property is beautifully built. A small building designed to feel relaxing and cozy. The koi pond in the middle is a main feature of its aesthetic. The location is on a small side street that makes it less busy and a nice respite from the buzzing city of da Nang. The room is spacious and very relaxing. A good place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. My favorite part of the stay was the service. Vicky at the reception was extremely welcoming and helpful. She was ready to answer any inquiry and help with looking for specific souvenirs and places that I wanted to find. Everyone else I met there (breakfast service and housekeeping) were friendly and helpful as well.

review.comment_positive: Unbelievable hotel, we didnâ€™t want to leave! the best beds we have had in Vietnam and rooms were perfect. breakfast was delicious and good for vegetarians. staff were amazing. laundry was good. coffee was great. location good aswell, right on the beach and a 5 minute grab ride to the town.

review.comment_positive: Such an incredibly stylish and beautiful hotel. Was very impressed and the staff was so lovely. Would definitely come back if I was in Da Nang again!
La dÃ©coration, la gentillesse du personnel, le petit dÃ©jeuner

I had an exceptional stay at Minh Boutique. The staff was heart-warmingly welcoming and helpful. They went far and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed. I didn't have cash on the first night, so they took me to the ATM. Just one of the many gestures that amazed me. The facilities were spotless, clean, and stylish. The location was very convenient with lots of good restaurants and shops around. Because the hotel isn't situated by the main roads, it was quiet and I had a good rest throughout the stay. The breakfast was excellent with both Vietnamese and Western options that changed daily. I want to send special thanks to Emma, Vi, and Minh for a memorable stay <3. I'll stay at Minh Boutique again when I return back to Da Nang.

review.comment_positive:
Everything was absolutely perfect. Outstanding. The staff was kind, polite, smiling and attentive, always ready to help. We had a welcome tea. review.rating: A relaxing stay in Da Nang
review.comment_positive: The Minh Boutique was everything we were looking for: friendly staff, beautiful facilities, and a strategic location. The hotel serves a really good breakfast with both Western and local options. Lan, the member of staff who took care of us, was very kind and attentive to our requests. Staff at the reception were also extremely kind, arranging takeaway breakfast for us since we had to leave for the airport at 5 am! There was plenty of space, cleanliness, and tranquility in the room. It was a wonderful experience for my husband and me!
review.comment_negative: The airconditioning system could to be more powerful

review.comment_positive: We opted for the penthouse unit, and I must say it exceeded our expectations. The unit is incredibly pleasant, offering ample space, cleanliness, and an overall charming aesthetic. The staff members were exceptionally friendly and helpful, even providing us with great lunch recommendations. The breakfast offered was reasonably satisfying. What I truly appreciate about this boutique hotel is its serene/quiet atmosphere. Unlike larger hotels, there were no large groups crowding the dining area or the pool, allowing us to enjoy the space in peace. The pool was a delightful addition to our stay. I want to express my sincere gratitude to the staff for their exceptional service throughout our time here.  All we did the whole day was to spend our time in the room, have a drink inside watching the pool outside, so enjoyable.
review.comment_negative: I was quite surprised by the bathtub and shower in the accommodation. I must say that the shower system's heating capacity was insufficient for longer-term use. It took multiple cycles of water reheating for the bathtub to be filled up completely. Unfortunately, this significantly impacted the enjoyment of the bathtub as it took a considerable amount of time to fill.

Perfect for the price!  It was my first trip to Vietnam and I felt welcomed.  It is decorated with an exotic feel and is really pretty.  It's prettier than the picture.  The staff are really friendlyğŸ‘.  The room is clean and the air conditioning works well.  The rooftop pool is great.  For breakfast, you can choose noodles/eggs and bread and you can also order drinks.  Somehow, I ate both, and it was delicious.  I applied for airport pickup service, and a friendly driver was waiting for me.  It was also cheap at $7!  If I go to Da Nang again, I will definitely go there!  Thank you to the staff.  Thanks to you, I was able to start my trip in a good mood!

Two points
1) Some pillows were smelled damp a bit, like half dried. Three pillows out of 4, we did not use because of the smell.

review.comment_positive: The ambiance is simply breathtaking, coupled with an ideal location that offers a serene and peaceful atmosphere. The staff are always warm and welcoming with their ever-present smiles, making us feel at home. And let's not forget the pricing, which is just right for the value and quality of service provided.

The beds and pillows were very comfortable. It was literally the best beds we've ever slept on. 

The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our flight was delayed, and they offered to make us sandwiches for our arrival.  

The pond at reception was super relaxing and the rooms lovely.
review.comment_negative:
The staff should not allow children to play the piano as it is in the breakfast area, and it's very noisy. 

There were no bedside tables by the beds which could be a nice add up.

review.rating: Really beautiful hotel, requires some slight improvements
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ Queen NhÃ¬n Ra VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive: The staff were so lovely, the room was beautiful and the facilities were great, including a rooftop pool with wonderful views of the city. Check in was quick and easy and Mun provided us with recommendations for tours of Da Nang ğŸ˜Š
review.comment_negative:
Our room was directly under the swimming pool and we could hear loud banging from people using the rooftop pool above us. We weren't made aware of this at check in and so this was very disappointing. They did give us free orange juices to the room to apologise in fairness to them.

Also, we booked a room with a "garden view" which should overlook the courtyard in the middle of the hotel, however you need to go out into the communal hallway to view this.

review.rating: Lovely boutique hotel for a comfortable stay.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive: The hotel has a very nice vibe. There is a beautiful Koi fish pond in reception. The breakfast was nice although simple yet filling. The room is cute and large range of TV channel options which was nice for evening. Rooftop pool is nice but not enough places to sit. The room is nice and comfortable but some design flaws (such as the blinds block the bathroom door from opening properly).
review.comment_negative: The reception was friendly and helpful but perhaps a bit invasive. They regularly sent whats app messages to ask if I needed recommendation. Although some might appreciate this, if I need recommendations, I will ask myself at the reception desk. I would advise reception to avoid this approach or at least ask customers if they would like to have this service when they arrive. For me, I found it a bit much as I had already done my research. I also feel that asking for a 10 star review from customers (which we experienced a lot in Vietnam) is not a great approach. Rather, simply ask customers to review their experience. Getting honest feedback is how we continually get better.

review.comment_positive: What a fantastic hotel!! We were only going to stay 1 night, but we found this gorgeous looking hotel (and very affordable) so decided to stay 2 nights. We were so happy with our decision. Young at reception was soooooooo helpful. She went above and beyond with anything we needed and provided us with so many recommendations dependent on what kind of thing we were feeling like doing. All the staff were just lovely. Itâ€™s a short walk to the beach which is stunning, and we loved our visit to Marble Mountains.  The hotel itself feels so tranquil and the pool was an absolute saviour after a morning/afternoon of activities. I recommend staying here if you want somewhere close to the beach.
review.comment_negative: Nothing - we loved everything.

review.rating: Disappointed that the reality didn't live up to expectations based on the positive reviews.
review.comment_positive:
Good location, easy to walk to the beach with lots of mini marts, pharmacies, cafes and restaurants around. 
Service is nice. Appreciated that reception makes an effort to help sort out activities and restaurant bookings. And they offered a free shuttle ride to Hoi An as compensation when we expressed our disappointment with the stay (because they asked). That was a thoughtful gesture that we appreciated. 
Great water pressure in the shower. 
wifi is good.
review.comment_negative:
Upon pulling up to the hotel, it looks very dark with hardly anything being lit up. 
The hotel itself and the rooms felt a lot smaller and darker in person than they look online. 
Really disappointed with the functionality of the rooms. Surprised the reviews don't mention this more. No bedside tables, no bedside lights, nowhere to hang clothes or place things in the bathroom (slanted, miniscule counter space), no luggage racks available, toilet cubicle is extremely tight, steps to navigate in a dark room, a few unusable bamboo hangers in the closet, water drains slowly in the sinks, tv remote didn't work...to give you a sense. 
Though it looked surface clean we never really felt relaxed there. Didn't like seeing housekeeping rinsing out the floor mop in our bathroom sink. 
Breakfast was pretty bad with few choices of pretty low quality if you're used to hotel buffets. 
The pool was closed 2 out of 3 afternoons that we were there due to maintenance/cleaning?

Minh Boutique was situated in a great location - surrounded by amazing restaurants and amenities. The surroundings were also quiet which is great for a good nightâ€™s sleep. The beds were soft and comfortable and the interior designs of the place was well done too. During our stay, Phoebe (Phuong) was extremely hospitable and she was determined to make our stay a great one! I would highly recommend staying at Minh Boutique if you are looking for accessible and comfortable stay in Danang!

review.comment_positive:
The staff was very helpful and supportive and they were very attentive in helping all our questions and concerns.

Very friendly staff

review.rating: Fully recommend for a relaxing stay.
review.comment_positive:
I donâ€™t normally write reviews but I feel like I have to for Minh Boutique. 

I stayed here for the solo portion of my travels through Vietnam. Due to weather conditions, I knew Iâ€™d be spending more time in room than normal, so this was a bit of a luxury booking. 

I had arrived early for check-in after a 16 hour sleeper bus from Hanoi and was drenched from the hour walk from where the bus stopped. Seeing this, the staff very kindly made my room available to me right away, even though I was early - this was greatly appreciated. I was guided to a lovely studio room with a TV, kitchenette (one hob - enough for pasta or eggs, etc.) and lots of other nice features.

I did have an issue the first night, there was a loud and constant sound similar to a telephone ringing from somewhere outside through my closed back window, (I suspected from the kitchens below) and so I struggled to sleep (even though Iâ€™d been up for the last 40 hours). I will admit I do suffer from misophonia, but I do think this would have affected anyone, so I decided to complain (which I rarely do). The staff were incredibly apologetic (even though it wasnâ€™t really their fault) and extremely accommodating, and moved me to a new room on the other side, for which I was again very grateful.

Overall I had a perfect stay. There is a K-Mart on the opposite side of the block, with everything you could need, and a mall about 30 min walk away if you need other more specific items. The rooms are very clean and relaxing. The breakfast is great, sort of a Vietnamese continental, with different specials offered each day. The laundry service is also fantastic. But above all, the lovely staff were who really made my stay so worry free. 

Thank you Minh Boutique.

A bunch of restaurants, pubs, and convenience stores are close by. I got lazy and didn't go check out the rooftop pool but apparently, it seems nice. Also, the complimentary buffet breakfast exceeded my expectation as well, it was pretty nice.
review.comment_negative: I booked a 90-minute in-room massage and didn't enjoy it that much. The massage itself was like 4-5/10. The lady complained about how she only received a lot less than how much the hotel was charging and demanded a tip at the end tho I told her that I'd add that to the total payment with the hotel. Not really the hotel's fault since it's like an outsourced/collaborative service but yeah :) I'd recommend going to the actual spa and saving yourself some headache but maybe I was just unlucky and met that one particular massage lady.

review.rating: Best Hotel during our stay in vietnam
review.comment_positive: Beautiful Hotel, extremely comfy beds, great location. Truly the best place we have stayed in vietnam, probably generally. Definitely recommend ğŸ‘Œ
review.comment_negative: Our room was on the top floor and we could slightly hear the water pipes/pump when any water was being used in the hotel. Not loud, but enough to be noticed. Maybe a bit of insolation on the ceiling would get rid of it. DEFINITELY NOT A DEALBREAKER THOUGH. Still loved it

review.rating: Disappointing... I cut my stay short
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive: The hotel is easy to find and has a stunning little oasis in the centre of it. The design of the rooms is good (apart from the open-panelled ceiling which means you can see the pipes and cobwebs overhead). The bed was very comfortable and the shower was strong. It was very clean. The staff gave me a lovely welcome tea and helped take my bag to the room. The view from the roof is really nice. The beaches nearby are great. The staff did listen to my feedback and offered to pay for my taxi when I left as compensation which was appreciated.
review.comment_negative: There are several reasons why I wouldn't stay here again. The room had no toilet paper when I entered and dead TV remote batteries. The bidet tap was leaking. I was woken by the smell of cigarette smoke entering my non-smoking room (I think via the air conditioning?) which was really unpleasant. The breakfast was small and basic and towards the end of service it was messy and unappetising. The breakfast staff were on their phones so there was no welcome or explanation of how to order egg dishes or where to find cutlery. I'm not super keen on birds in cages (2x in the jungley courtyard), while its a traditional hobby I found it quite sad. The pool and surrounding area is extremely small so really better for a quick dip rather than spending longer amounts of time there. There were only 2 bicycles to rent so unfortunately they weren't available. The location was ok but after exploring I found the area around My An much more vibrant and interesting. When the quality of so many hotels in Vietnam is so high this was a real disappointment. I cut my stay short and moved on.

review.rating: Handy location to beach and short distance to Da Nang city
review.comment_positive: The location is great and walkable to the beach and many restaurants. The large koi swimming add to the property. We were able to take the pool towels to the beach which is a short walk away and the hotel pool on the roof area is great. This is a mid size modern place in an area with many other hotels.

It is a great place to stay but not as amazing as we thought it would be :)

review.rating: excellent place to stay, I would have loved to stay more days

review.rating: Hidden gem with great staff and facilities for your stay in Da Nang
review.comment_positive: The location was amazing - close to everything you need and a 5 minute walk from the beach. The staff were really helpful and catered to our every need. Taxi/Trips are available at a very reasonable price and are easy to organise. The pool is a really nice added bonus and a welcome relief from the heat after a day sightseeing!

review.rating: A delightful experience for our first visit to Vietnam. Lovely hotel, lovely people, and lovely food
review.comment_positive: The daily breakfast had a small but interesting spread of local dishes. You can also place an order for eggs (omelette, sunny side, etc) or noodles (which changes by the day). The hotel itself is located near to My Khe Beach and a host of eateries (less than 10 min walk). It is a quaint apartment with lots of greenery and a koi pond, nestled in an unsuspecting lane. The staff are exceptional and go out of the way to please, e.g., always asking if you need something, serving you tea and biscuits when you are waiting or seated downstairs. Most places of interest are accessible by Grab or you can book one of the many day tours through the hotel.
review.comment_negative: There were some issues with the water pressure as we were on the fifth floor but this was promptly attended to by the hotel's maintenance staff.

review.comment_positive: The bed was great

review.comment_negative: Breakfast could be better described to ensure safety for allergic and dietary restricted persons. I was bit disappointed with plastic water bottles while you claim to care highly about sustainability. Please change those to refillable glass bottles. It would also be great to be able to have a snack apart from breakfast - simple french fries would be a great help when stuck at the hotel during an evening storm. Pillows are too big and did not feel great for my neck but that's just my personal preference, other person may like it.

review.comment_positive: The interior design is awesome and relaxing. The staffs are friendly, helpful and welcoming. I suffered from diarrhea and fever caused by food poisoning after eating at Con Market. The staffs took care of me a lot, they helped to buy medicine, brought me ginger tea and some light snacks after 10pm, kept in touch with me via whatsapp till I got well. I was so lucky and grateful to have their help as I am travelling alone. I will recommend Minh Boutique to my friends if they would like to visit Da Nang.
review.comment_negative: Something can be improved, for example, soundproof (I heard alarms from the room next to mine at 3am), location of sockets (no sockets at bedside)
